title: CV Dazzle
description: Fashion styles, haircuts, and makeup designed to circumvent machine vision and surveillance systems.

title: Europe Europe
description: Porcelain figurines in wooden cabinet. Based on traditional 18th century artworks, but updated for contemporary politics and society.

title: Han Dynasty Urn with Coca Cola Logo
description: Presumed original urns (bought at flea markets), repainted with modern logos.

title: World Map
description: Made of thousands of layers of thin cotton cloth, the map is created in a way that makes it extremely labor intensive to install, illustrating China’s status as a platform for cheap labor in the clothing industry. China is the world’s largest producer of cotton and a leading manufacturer of textiles and clothes.
keywords: ai weiwei china chinese world fabric felt capitalism market consumerism

title: Ai Weiwei in the Elevator When Taken into Custody by the Police
Thermopaper 2
description: A big sheet of thermochromic paper is slowly wound from one spool to another. A rotating heat source draws a circle on the paper, one cycle per minute.
keywords: minimal abstract tech thermopaper testkeyword heat element

title: Spam Architecture
description: The images from the Spam Architecture series are generated by a computer program that accepts as input, junk email. Various patterns, keywords and rhythms found in the text are translated into three-dimensional modeling gestures.

title: Bank of America Palm Springs
description: "The artwork was intended to be a visual metaphor for the havoc that banking practices have caused to the economy." Schaefer is interested in disaster capitalism.
keywords: disaster capitalism painting bank fire burning police

title: September 15th
description: "This envelope contains a photograph by Alfredo Jaar of Karl Marx’s grave in Highgate Cemetery, London. The purchaser of this work agrees to view this image only once a year, on September 15, the anniversary of the day Lehman Brothers declared bankruptcy in New York."

title: James Franco as Bruce Nauman
description: "A contemporary update of Nauman’s Art Make-Up video piece from 1967, shot on location at the Standard Hotel, New York. The themes the artist was exploring seem perfectly in sync with Franco’s own hall-of-mirrors aesthetic: “make-up,” the stuff an actor smears on his face, assumes a double entendre as a verb—to make up, the very essence of any creative act. The video is the first in a new series by Chernick in which contemporary artists are enlisted to star in remakes of seminal video artworks, prompting a dialogue between the original artwork and the artist reinterpreting it."
keywords: celebrity james franco bruce nauman makeup video vid

title: Log Jammer
description: "This is a cellphone jammer put in a log in the woods, in order to create a safe space in nature. It was tested in the lab (no illegal shit) and was a part of my Master’s thesis at ITP. Part of this project was largely inspired by this Deleuze quote."
keywords: cell tower log forest jammer radio signal

title: Public Smog
description: Artist organized to purchase and retire carbon emmissions offsets for the public good.
keywords: carbon dioxide emissions offsets california smog global warming factory

title: A-Z Comfort Units
description: "while they are generally useful in some way, incorporating an implied social or domestic function, the critic Jan Avgikos has argued that 'Nothing about Zittel’s art suggests itself as a remedy for what ails the masses. Rather, in “A-Z’s” advocacy of an idealized lifestyle, the configuration constantly generated is that of the individual … All "A-Z" lifestyle products and services are highly personalized. As such, they join ranks with the worldwide flood of personal shoppers, and personal computers, and personal-size tissues and personal everything!'"

title: Stella's Stoichiometry (All things being equal, 6 lbs. 13 oz.)
Look to the Heavens
description: "Using a computer program to calculate these historic vistas, I then sew the star patterns into painted, hand-dyed renderings of the night sky. Through the hand-sewing of these passages of time, I mirror my own contemplative act with the age-old existential act of stargazing."
